SENT.plain: The clinical course of 100 consecutive patients with angiographically proven carotid occlusion was reviewed
Ninety-three patients had been hospitalised for early stroke appropriate to the occlusion, and seven for transient ischaemic attacks
68 patients were followed up from 1.5 to 5.9 years
The observed five year survival rate on an actuarial basis was 62.3%, compared to the expected rate of 90% in a matched normal population
The observed rate of recurrent stroke was 4.8% at 1 year
Among survivors, six patients (11.3%) developed seizures
